Class BlockWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simplity.tp.BlockWorker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageClient, DbClientInterface

    public class BlockWorker
extends Object
implements DbClientInterface, MessageClient
    block of actions. we have created this as a class to improve re-use across service and loopAction
    Author:
    simplity.org

    • Method Detail

      • workWithDriver

        public boolean workWithDriver(DbDriver driver)
        Description copied from interface: DbClientInterface
        use an instance of rdbDriver to take care of all your rdb operations. Note that the rdbDriver instance will work only inside this method. You should not keep a pointer to this instance beyond this method. However, even if you do, the instance CAN NOT be used for any rdb operation, because it would have released all resources.
        Specified by:
        workWithDriver in interface DbClientInterface
        Returns:
        true if operation is successful. All operations are committed. False in case any error, in which case operations are rolled-back.

      • act

        public boolean act(DbDriver driver)
        act on all the actions
        Parameters:
        driver -
        Returns:
        true if we completed all actions. False if a stop was encountered and we stopped in between.

      • execute

        public JumpSignal execute(DbDriver driver)
        execute this block once
        Parameters:
        driver -
        Returns:
        null if it is a normal exit, or a specific signal

      • process

        public boolean process(ServiceContext sameCtxComingBack)
        Description copied from interface: MessageClient
        process a message. Data content of the message is already extracted into the ctx.
        Specified by:
        process in interface MessageClient
        Parameters:
        sameCtxComingBack - service context where this is all happening. Data in the incoming message is extracted into this.
        Returns:
        true if all ok, and the session should be committed. false if something went wrong, and the session is to be rolled back.

      • toContinue

        public boolean toContinue()
        Description copied from interface: MessageClient
        should the consumer continue to consume? Provides a way to interrupt or shut-down the operation
        Specified by:
        toContinue in interface MessageClient
        Returns:
        true if the consumer should continue. False means time to shut down.
